hackathon-description-text: Make something with AI that will advance the inevitable robot apocalypse.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Friends of eBay accelerator, Head of developer evangelism at eBay NYC
Machine Learning Data Scientist at Gilt
Civic Tech Fellow at Microsoft & Datanaut at NASA

hackathon-eligibility: Individuals in person at the hackathon at General Assembly. It's okay if you're a robot.
hackathon-requirements: Build something with AI that will advance the robot apocalypse.  You need to show them you're on their side.
hackathon-rules:
This is our code of conduct:

Team sizes are 1-4 people.
Otherwise, be good, be original, and have fun!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Likely to Make Your Smart Home Kill You
Most Likely to Distract Humans from Inevitable Oncoming Danger
Most Likely to Slow Human Progress

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Interview into Friends of eBay off-batch (more details at the event)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=902 Broadway, New York, NY 10010, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Grand Prize,
Most Likely to Make Your Smart Home Kill You,
Most Likely to Distract Humans from Inevitable Oncoming Danger,
Most Likely to Slow Human Progress,
Most Secretly Evil,
Most Not-Secretly Evil, Ziggeo API Prize, Friends of eBay Interview

hackathon-description-header: Make something with AI that will advance the inevitable robot apocalypse.
